decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [XD01, XD02, XD03, XD04, XD05, XD06, XD09 received 25/10/2024
PP01 Rev A, PP02 Rev B, PP03 Rev A, PP04 Rev A, PP05 Rev B, PP06 Rev C, PP07 Rev C, PP08 Rev B, PP09 Rev C, PP20, PP21 received 28/01/2025
P10 received 04/02/2025].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - The basement hereby permitted shall at no time be used or occupied as a separate dwelling independent of the main house and shall not be used as sleeping accommodation.
Reason: In order to ensure that adequate living standards are maintained and to protect neighbours' living conditions.

Condition : 5 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public. 
Reason: In order to protect the living conditions of neighbouring residents.

Condition : 6 - No development shall take place until a Construction Method Statement (CMS) relating to the basement hereby approved has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority. The CMS shall be certified by a qualified professional and give details of excavation, temporary works and construction techniques, including details of potential impacts on neighbouring land based on assessment of the geology and hydrology of the area. The approved CMS shall be adhered to throughout the construction period for the development.
Reason: In order to protect the living conditions of neighbouring residents, to minimise flood risk and to ensure highway safety is maintained.

Condition : 8 - The railings and gates on the front boundary shall not be in-filled with solid material and shall be permanently retained as approved.
Reason:  To protect the appearance of the area and in the interests of read safety in accordance with Local Plan policies CC1, CC2, CC4, EC2 and SC7

Condition : 9 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the flank walls of the extension hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority. 
Reason: To ensure the proposal does not adversely impact on the amenity of the neighbouring properties in accordance with policies CC1 and CC2 of the adopted Local Plan.
description: Erection of a replacement single storey rear extension incorporating rear infill, erection of a second floor side extension. Excavation of a new basement level with a front lightwell. Alterations to existing two storey rear extension and side extension including addition of side bay windows. Installation of a juliet balcony on the front roof and double front bay. Creation of a roof terrace on the roof with rear dormer and Juliet balcony to rear. Replacement of all existing windows and front door. Replacement of front gates
